dating-20.op_claim: I Firmly Believe Online Dating is like Giving Up in the Real World and the Only Women on There are Either Conventionally Unattractive or, if They Are Attractive, Have Some Sort of Personality Flaw. CMV.
dating-20.op_premise: [I once had a conversation with a friend that went something like:, Me: She\s pretty hot, but I don\t think she has a fuck buddy right now., Him: No, fuck that. A girl that hot can\t not be fucking someone regularly, For some reason, this conversation has stuck with me. I only ever had one girlfriend for 8 months during my freshman year of college. Now, as a senior in college, I had only had a couple drunk hookups since then., My parents awkwardly said to me one day, You know, fourth_alternate, we realized you hadn\t dated anyone since freshman year. I highly recommend you give online dating a try. This frustrated me. Now my parents didn\t even believe in me to try to start a relationship the real way. I had always equated online dating with giving up, Now, I thought that people give up for three reasons:, They are too unattractive to have the confidence to try to get a date in the real world, They are too awkward in the real world, They have some sort of crazy personality flaw that one could easily recognize in the real world, but not online., In my mind, there is no reason why a sane, somewhat attractive woman (both physically and psychologically) would not be able to find a date in real life, and would have to resort to online dating. It makes no fucking sense to me. CMV., EDIT: Wow. All these responses were amazing and well thought-out. I guess the only way to really is to try it myself. For now, consider me. I would award it to a specific person, but everyone who responded had very unique, yet solid points to make. Thanks everyone! I do have some... err... unconventional views about things, but I will always come here in the future if I want someone to C my V!]

reply_contents.content: I met my gf online, shes amazing
Weve been dating for over a year
My case is a little different though, I live in a small town in Japan so options for traditional dating were limited
But if you want a regular success story, my brother met a beautiful women online and they dated for 3ish years
Theyve since broken up but that has nothing to do with how they met
As omegatheta said, your stated conversation hints that you dont know a lot about women
Will you accept some general dating advice, not related to where to meet
Don\t use the word fuck buddy
Don\t talk to your parents other than broad generalities
Make some female friends, purely platonic
This will help you to understand how women think/feel/act, plus their advice is invaluable
Focus on turning yourself into someone that someone would want to date, i.e. exercise, dress well, read a book or two, get some interests (for me it was music, but for you it can be anything)
Dont wear sweatshirts if you do that you can meet women online and in real life
People generally meet partners through family/friends, work, school, church/clubs, and occasionally at bars or other social places of business
If someone works at a small place of business without contact with the general public then that one is out altogether
If they work long hours, a non-standard shift, or a second job then they dont have time to go out to bars or other social businesses
If they are out of school and already tried out those people that their family/friends introduce to them (or dont trust family/friends sufficiently) then those are out as well
That leaves Church or social clubs, previous scheduling issues aside, not everyone holds such memberships
In this situation how else is someone supposed to meet anyone aside from literally tripping over them
Even if you are out and about that doesnt mean that you are receptive to romantic propositions
Thats one big advantage to dating sites, you know everyone else there is actively looking
